Run API in background to test/develop it

Source: R/api_run.R
api_run.Rd

Run API in background to test/develop it

Usage

api_run(
  fname = system.file("plumber/plumber.R", package = "EJAM"),
  host = "127.0.0.1",
  port = 3035,
  quiet = FALSE
)

Arguments

fname

file with API definition using plumber package

host

optional, localhost IP

port

optional, a port number

quiet

optional, set to TRUE To reduce info printed to console

Value

NA

Examples

# launch and try it in R console
 api_run()

 urlx <- "http://127.0.0.1:3035/getblocksnearby?lat=33&lon=-99&radius=2"
 reqx <- httr2::request(urlx)
 httr2::req_dry_run(reqx)
#> GET /getblocksnearby HTTP/1.1
#> accept: */*
#> accept-encoding: deflate, gzip, br, zstd
#> host: 127.0.0.1:3035
#> user-agent: httr2/1.2.1 r-curl/7.0.0 libcurl/8.5.0
#> 
 outx <- httr2::req_perform(reqx)
#> Error in httr2::req_perform(reqx): Failed to perform HTTP request.
#> Caused by error in `curl::curl_fetch_memory()`:
#> ! Couldn't connect to server [127.0.0.1]:
#> Failed to connect to 127.0.0.1 port 3035 after 0 ms: Couldn't connect to server
 s2b <- data.table::rbindlist(httr2::resp_body_json(outx))
#> Error: object 'outx' not found
 s2b
#> Error: object 's2b' not found
